revised_title: Electronic Properties of Tetrahedral Intermetallic Compounds: Charge Distribution
tldr: This article discusses the electronic properties of tetrahedral intermetallic compounds, focusing on charge distribution and bonding. The authors describe the compounds in terms of localized molecular-orbital bonds and link the definitions of covalency and polarity with the net ionicity of the atoms in the crystal. They provide non-empirical calculations for boron nitride and present a semi-empirical analysis for estimating the coefficients in the molecular-orbital description. The charges predicted by these methods agree well with experimental values.
